papers.title: Muses: Designing, Composing, Generating Nonexistent Fantasy 3D Creatures without Training
Automated Semantic Rules Detection (ASRD) for Emergent Communication Interpretation
NavAI: A Generalizable LLM Framework for Navigation Tasks in Virtual Reality Environments
Proceedings 16th International Workshop on Graph Computation Models
Shallow-circuit Supervised Learning on a Quantum Processor

items.title: Muses: Training-Free Fantastic 3D Creature Generation via Skeletons
items.summary: Muses utilizes 3D skeletons and graph-constrained reasoning to generate realistic, harmoniously composed fantastic creatures in a training-free, feed-forward paradigm.
items.authors: Hexiao Lu, Xiaokun Sun, Zeyu Cai

items.title: Interpreting Multi-Agent Emergent Communication via the ASRD Algorithm
items.summary: The Automated Semantic Rules Detection (ASRD) algorithm extracts meaningful patterns from agent-developed languages to make emergent communication interpretable.
items.authors: Bastien Vanderplaetse, Xavier Siebert, Stéphane Dupont

items.title: NavAI: LLM-Powered Navigation for Immersive VR Environments
items.summary: NavAI is a generalizable framework that leverages Large Language Models to automate complex goal-directed navigation and exploration in diverse Virtual Reality applications.

items.title: GCM 2025: Advances in Graph Computation and System Modeling
items.summary: This volume explores the latest foundations and applications of graph-based computation models where graphs serve as primary modeling structures.

items.title: Scaling Quantum ML via Linear Hamiltonian Ground States
items.summary: This work introduces a scalable quantum machine learning framework using Hamiltonian ground states and Krylov diagonalization to efficiently process classical data on 50-qubit hardware.
items.authors: Luca Candelori, Swarnadeep Majumder, Antonio Mezzacapo
